TEXT.English: From the hilltop, the valley's importance to the Bannor supplies was visible even to the simplest of minds. Lush with large green and yellow patches of fine wheat and corn farmlands, this single region provided sustenance for nearly a quarter of the Bannor's entire force, and consequently, housed a whole legion of battle-hardened guards. For all their might however, when the first snowflakes landed on a summer day, they had lost. From that northern hilltop, the Priests of Winter chanted, inaudible to the soldiers above the now howling gale and dead frost-covered crops. As the blizzard moved into the valley and continued to roar, the Bannor legion realized the battle on the front line would soon turn, and not in their favor.

TEXT.English: [TAB]It was dusk when the Stonewarden arrived. Few had ever actually seen one in this small village, but I knew his cause full well. The dwarves all made way for him, a few offering cautious greetings, which he ignored. He stopped in a clearing at the other edge of town and surveyed his surroundings, then sat down and began to chant. Soon the earth began to shake, and a cloud of dust surrounded the Stonewarden. The small dwarf children clung tightly to their mothers as the loud scraping of earth and rock echoed through the village. In minutes it was over, and jagged edges of stone began to peak through as the dust settled. Centered where the Stonewarden had sat now stood a Temple of Kilmorph. When the next disciple of the earth mother arrived in this village, they would find a more than receptive group of followers."[PARAGRAPH:2]- recollections of Marost Dzorad, 43rd Treasurer of the Merchants' Guild of Kazak
TEXT.French: [TAB]It was dusk when the Stonewarden arrived. Few had ever actually seen one in this small village, but I knew his cause full well. The dwarves all made way for him, a few offering cautious greetings, which he ignored. He stopped in a clearing at the other edge of town and surveyed his surroundings, then sat down and began to chant. Soon the earth began to shake, and a cloud of dust surrounded the Stonewarden. The small dwarf children clung tightly to their mothers as the loud scraping of earth and rock echoed through the village. In minutes it was over, and jagged edges of stone began to peak through as the dust settled. Centered where the Stonewarden had sat now stood a Temple of Kilmorph. When the next disciple of the earth mother arrived in this village, they would find a more than receptive group of followers."[PARAGRAPH:2]- recollections of Marost Dzorad, 43rd Treasurer of the Merchants' Guild of Kazak
TEXT.German: [TAB]Es war Sonnenuntergang als der Edelsteinwächter ankam. Nur wenige hatten bisher einen gesehen in dem kleinen Dorf, aber ich kannte seine Beweggründe sehr gut. Die Zwerge machten ihm alle Platz, einige grüßten vorsichtig, doch er ignorierte sie. Er hielt an einer Lichtung am anderen Ende des Dorfes an und musterte seine Umgebung, setzte sich dann hin und begann damit zu singen. Sofort begann die Erde zu beben und eine Staubwolke umgab den Steinwächter. Die kleinen Zwergenkinder klammerten sich fest an ihre Mütter als das Kratzen von Erde und Gestein durch das Dorf hallte. Minuten später war es zu Ende und zerklüftete Steinecken ragten auf als sich der Staub legte. Wo der Edelsteinwächter saß, war nun ein Tempel von Kilmorph gestanden. Sobald der nächste Jünger der Erdmutter in diesem Dorf ankäme, würde er eine mehr als empfängliche Gruppe von Anhängern vorfinden."[PARAGRAPH:2] - Erinnerungen Marost Dzorads, 43. Schatzmeister der Händlergilde von Kazak

TEXT.English: [ITALIC]1[\ITALIC]. Scorch terraforms all terrain. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Tundra->Taiga->Plains->Desert[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Marsh->Grass->Plains->Desert[NEWLINE][ITALIC]2[\ITALIC]. Scorching a Plains tile containing a feature will clear the feature, and has a chance to create scrubs based on the feature. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forest/New Forest- 33% chance. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Jungle- 25% chance. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Ancient Forest- 20% chance. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Burnt Forest- Feature destroyed, no chance for scrub. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Haunted Lands- Unaffected. [NEWLINE][ITALIC]3[\ITALIC]. Casting Scorch while in a flammable feature has a chance to create Smoke, and flush out a defender. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A forest has a chance of spawning an Animal defender, ranging from a common Wolf to a Satyr. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A Jungle has a chance to spawn a Barbarian Goblin or Lizard, ranging from a simple Goblin to a Lizard Ranger or Assassin. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]A Burnt Forest has a high chance of spawning a Demon Mistform that will last 5 turns. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]An Ancient Forest will always spawn a Demon Treant that will last 5 turns. [NEWLINE][ITALIC]4[\ITALIC]. Scorching a riverside Plains tile will create a floodplain after a delay of several turns.
TEXT.French: [ITALIC]1[\ITALIC]. Brûlure terraforme tous les terrains.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Toundra->Taïga->Plaine->Désert[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Marais->Prairie->Plaine->Désert[NEWLINE][ITALIC]2[\ITALIC]. Brûler une case de Plaine possédant une ressource supprimera cette ressource et aura une chance d'en créer une de type broussaille selon la ressource détruite.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forêt/Nouvelle Forêt - 33% de chance.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Jungle - 25% de chance.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forêt Ancestrale - 20% de chance.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Forêt Calcinée - Ressource détruite, aucune chance de créer une broussaille.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Terres Hantées - Sans effet.[NEWLINE][ITALIC]3[\ITALIC]. Lancer le sort Brûlure sur une ressource inflammable a une chance de créer de la Fumée et expluser un défenseur.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Une Forêt a une chance de voir apparaître un défenseur animal, pouvant aller du loup commun au Satyre.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Une Jungle a une chance de faire apparaître un Gobelin ou un Lézard barbare, allant du simple Gobelin au Ranger Lézard ou l'Assassin.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Une Forêt Calcinée a une forte chance de faire apparaître un Démon Brumeux qui restera 5 tours.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Une Forêt Ancienne fera toujours apparaître un Tréant Démoniaque qui restera 5 tours.[NEWLINE][ITALIC]4[\ITALIC]. Brûler une Plaine adjacente à une rivière créera une Plaine Inondable après un délai de quelques tours.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Temporarily blocks all XP gain for enemy units
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Empêche temporairement tout gain d'EXP pour les unités ennemies
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Temporarily blocks all XP gain for enemy units
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Temporarily blocks all XP gain for enemy units
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Temporarily blocks all XP gain for enemy units

TEXT.English: When Mulcarn was the Angel of Winter, he was part of a natural order - a season that came and went. Since his fall he has taken on the aspect of Ice - frozen and unchanging. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Stasis Curse will prevent enemy units from gaining experience from normal combat. Special skills or promotions may still allow them to gain some experience however. This spell is ideal when assaulting a heavily defended position with weaker troops, as it prevents the defenders from gaining experience for each victory they win.
TEXT.French: Quand Mulcarn était l'Ange de l'Hiver, il faisait partie du cycle naturel, une saison qui s'en allait et revenait. Il a depuis sa chute pris l'aspect de la Glace, gelée et immuable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]La Malédiction de Stase empêche les ennemis de gagner de l'expérience lors des combats classiques. Certaines compétences spéciales ou promotions leurs permettront toutefois de gagner un peu d'expérience malgré tout. Ce sort est idéal pour un assaut avec des unités faibles sur une position lourdement défendue, car il empêche les défenseurs de gagner de l'expérience pour chaque combat gagné.
TEXT.German: Als Mulcarn der Engel des Winters war, war er ein Teil der natürlichen Ordnung - eine Jahrezeit kam und ging. Seit seinem Fall hat er den Aspekt des Eises angenommen - gefroren und unveränderlich.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Der Stasis Fluch verwehrt feindlichen Einheiten Erfahrung durch gewonnene Kämpfe. Nur spezielle Fähigkeiten oder Beförderungen können ihnen noch einen Erfahrungszuwachs gewähren. Dieser Zauber eigent sich ideal für den Sturm auf stark verteidigte Positionen mit schwächeren Truppen, da die Verteidiger keine Erfahrung mehr durch jeden einzelnen Sieg gewinnen. Sehr sehr gemein!
TEXT.Italian: When Mulcarn was the Angel of Winter, he was part of a natural order - a season that came and went. Since his fall he has taken on the aspect of Ice - frozen and unchanging.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Stasis Curse will prevent enemy units from gaining experience from normal combat. Special skills or promotions may still allow them to gain some experience however. This spell is ideal when assaulting a heavily defended position with weaker troops, as it prevents the defenders from gaining experience for each victory they win.
TEXT.Spanish: When Mulcarn was the Angel of Winter, he was part of a natural order - a season that came and went. TEXT.English: The walls of Cervedes remained unbreachable by the massed horde of the Clan - a shimmering field preventing their approach.
TEXT.French: The walls of Cervedes remained unbreachable by the massed horde of the Clan - a shimmering field preventing their approach.
TEXT.German: Die Mauern von Cervedes blieben undurchdringlich für die gesamte Horde des Clans - ein schimmerndes Feld verhinderte ihren Vorstoß.
TEXT.Italian: The walls of Cervedes remained unbreachable by the massed horde of the Clan - a shimmering field preventing their approach.
TEXT.Spanish: The walls of Cervedes remained unbreachable by the massed horde of the Clan - a shimmering field preventing their approach.

TEXT.English: The Wall of Force prevents any unit of less than Level 4 from attacking or entering the city, unless they are team-mates of the city's owner. This can prevent large stacks of weak troops from breaking down your defenders, though the field only lasts so long as the archmage remains in the city - beware of highly promoted assassins.
TEXT.French: The Wall of Force prevents any unit of less than Level 4 from attacking or entering the city, unless they are team-mates of the city's owner. This can prevent large stacks of weak troops from breaking down your defenders, though the field only lasts so long as the archmage remains in the city - beware of highly promoted assassins.
TEXT.German: Der "Wall der Macht" hindert jede Einheit mit einer Stufe von weniger als "4" am Angriff oder dem Betreten der Stadt, ausgenommen sind Teamkameraden des Besitzers der Stadt. Das verhindert, daß große Mengen an schwachen Truppen die Verteidiger überwältigen können. Es gilt zu beachten, daß der Zauber nur so lange aufrecht erhalten wird, wie der Erzmagier in der Stadt verweilt. Man nehme sich also vor erfahrenen Meuchelmördern in Acht.
TEXT.Italian: The Wall of Force prevents any unit of less than Level 4 from attacking or entering the city, unless they are team-mates of the city's owner. This can prevent large stacks of weak troops from breaking down your defenders, though the field only lasts so long as the archmage remains in the city - beware of highly promoted assassins.
TEXT.Spanish: The Wall of Force prevents any unit of less than Level 4 from attacking or entering the city, unless they are team-mates of the city's owner. This can prevent large stacks of weak troops from breaking down your defenders, though the field only lasts so long as the archmage remains in the city - beware of highly promoted assassins.

TEXT.English: This spell will sets Forests and Jungles alight. The flames may spread to nearby foliage but will eventually burn out of their own accord or can be dismissed through application of the [LINK=SPELL_SPRING]Spring[\LINK] spell. Useful for clearing jungles swiftly or attacking opponents who are especially proficient in forest and jungle terrain. Be wary of using it against [LINK=PROMOTION_ORC]Orcs[\LINK] who are naturally fire resistant.

TEXT.English: [TAB]"May your enemies plot in vain, their schemes foiled;[PARAGRAPH:1]May arms raised against you fall harmlessly aside;[PARAGRAPH:1]May your courage never falter, your spirit unafraid;[PARAGRAPH:1]And may judgment be true, for you follow the Code.[PARAGRAPH:1]Junil bless thee, brother."[PARAGRAPH:2]-ritual blessing of the Confessor
TEXT.French: [TAB] « puissent tes ennemis comploter en vain, leurs plans échouer;[PARAGRAPH:1]Puissent des Bras te retenir lorsque tu tomberas innocemment ; ;[PARAGRAPH:1] Puisse ton courage ne jamais faillir,Ton esprit sans peur;[PARAGRAPH:1]Et Puisse le jugement être vrai, Pour toi-même suis le Code.[PARAGRAPH:1]Junil te bénit, mon frère. » [PARAGRAPH:2]-Rituel de Bénédiction du Confesseur
TEXT.German: [TAB]"Mögen die Verschwörungen eurer Feinde vergebens sein und ihre Pläne zunichte gemacht werden;[PARAGRAPH:1] Mögen alle Arme, die gegen Euch erhoben werden harmlos beseite fallen;[PARAGRAPH:1] Möge Euer Mut nie schwanken und Euer Geist furchtlos sein;[PARAGRAPH:1] Und mögen die Urteile richtig sein, wenn ihr dem Kodex folgt. [PARAGRAPH:1]Junil segne Euch, Bruder!".[PARAGRAPH:2] - Ritueller Segen des Bekenners

TEXT.English: [TAB]The purposeful violation of a person's mind is often considered among the most serious atrocities imaginable. One's own mind is the ultimate sanctuary, a place that can't be directly reached by outsiders, a place where one is free to think whatever he desires.[PARAGRAPH:1]Yet many disagree with these notions, or more, dismiss them outright. A man affected by a charm spell is not gently tricked or pleasantly deceived-nay, he knows full well what's happening. He will feel the mage reaching into the depths of his mind, grasping all the feelings he has towards his loved ones, bending them until the treasured, prized emotions become horribly twisted. It is likely that it'll make the man hate the mage even more, a terrible, burning rage that struggles-but cannot defeat-the newborn love and admiration he feels towards the one who just raped his mind. With time, the mind will fight off the foreign influence-but in the meanwhile he'll love the mage so much he'd die for him. And often he does, unable to raise his hand in defense as the mage's comrades cut him down with laughter and merciless mockery.

One's own mind is the ultimate sanctuary, a place that can't be directly reached by outsiders, a place where one is free to think whatever he desires.[PARAGRAPH:1]Yet many disagree with these notions, or more, dismiss them outright. A man affected by a charm spell is not gently tricked or pleasantly deceived-nay, he knows full well what's happening. He will feel the mage reaching into the depths of his mind, grasping all the feelings he has towards his loved ones, bending them until the treasured, prized emotions become horribly twisted. It is likely that it'll make the man hate the mage even more, a terrible, burning rage that struggles-but cannot defeat-the newborn love and admiration he feels towards the one who just raped his mind. With time, the mind will fight off the foreign influence-but in the meanwhile he'll love the mage so much he'd die for him. And often he does, unable to raise his hand in defense as the mage's comrades cut him down with laughter and merciless mockery.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der gezielte Missbrauch der Gedanken einer Person wird oft als eine der schlimmsten Gräueltaten überhaupt angesehen. Die Gedanken eines Menschen sind die letzte Zuflucht, ein Platz der von anderen nicht erreicht werden kann, ein Platz, wo man darf, was man will.[PARAGRAPH:1] Viele sind gegen Gedankenkontrolle, oder lehnen sie gleich vollständig ab. Ein Mensch, der unter einem Beeindrucken-Zauber steht, wurde nicht beeinflusst oder betrogen, er ist im vollen Bewusstsein, was er tut. Er fühlt, wie der Zauberer in die Tiefen seines Bewusstseins vordringt, wie er seine Gefühle gegenüber den Geliebten an sich reißt und sie verändert, bis sie nicht mehr wieder zu erkennen sind. Es ist normal, dass der Verzauberte den Zauberer noch mehr hasst, eine schreckliche, brennende Wut, die mit der neu entstandenen Liebe zum Zauberer kämpft  doch zerstören kann sie sie nicht. Mit der Zeit können sich die Gedanken gegen den Zauber wehren  aber in dem Moment liebt der Verzauberte den Zauberer so sehr, dass er für ihn sterben würde, was oft passiert, wenn die Kameraden des Zauberers ihn mit schrecklichem Gelächter und gnadenlosem Hohn niedermetzeln, ohne dass er sich wehren kann...

TEXT.English: [TAB]The wild ones rule not by reason and persuasion as we do, nor by deference to tradition, nor even submission to the will of the god-king. They follow their leaders for one reason. They know that their leaders can trounce them in combat. This costs them all the benefits of the wisdom of age and robs their cities of any stability or continuity. But one's place in the world is always clear.[PARAGRAPH:1]Excerpt from Lilar Jaswin's "Interactions among the lesser races"
TEXT.French: [TAB]The wild ones rule not by reason and persuasion as we do, nor by deference to tradition, nor even submission to the will of the god-king. They follow their leaders for one reason. They know that their leaders can trounce them in combat. This costs them all the benefits of the wisdom of age and robs their cities of any stability or continuity. But one's place in the world is always clear.[PARAGRAPH:1]Excerpt from Lilar Jaswin's "Interactions among the lesser races"
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Wilden regieren nicht aus einem Grund oder einer Überzeugung, auch nicht aus Rücksichtsnahme zu alten Traditionen oder aus Untergebenheit zu den Göttern. Sie folgen ihren Anführern aus einem Grund. Sie wissen, dass ihre Anführer sie im Kampf vernichten können. Dies kostet sie alle Vorteile der Weisheit des Alters, und raubt ihren Städten jegliche Stabilität. Doch der Platz des Einzelnen in der Welt ist immer klar.[PARAGRAPH:1]Auszug Lilar Jaswins "Wechselbeziehungen unter den niederen Rassen"

TEXT.English: [TAB]The enemy was almost upon us, and nobody in the camp was prepared. Our scouts had failed us, and we would be set upon in moments. Soldiers grabbed up their weapons in frantic preparation. Yet in the midst of all this the adept sent to assist us was strangely passive. He simply stood in the center of the camp, and started whistling... an eerie tune, with an unearthly melody. I took him for mad, but then the sound intensified, becoming louder than a human could possibly produce. In the next moment, a strange impulse came upon me, drawing me forward to meet the enemy charge. All around, I could see my allies, scattered about at random... but then both sides met... and something strange happened. Although our forces held no discernable line, each man was somehow in position to repel the enemy's first strike. Despite our total confusion, and the lack of any kind of preparation or planning, not a single enemy soldier entered the camp. Throughout this all, that haunting melody continued, and the battle seemed to mimic the strange rhythms of the tune.[PARAGRAPH:1]The moment passed, and the song faded, but by the time it did, every one of our men was on his feet and fighting, and the whole of the enemy's first wave lay dead or dying.[PARAGRAPH:1]- Excerpt from the Diary of Anton Sandor, of the 3rd Infantry Legion

He simply stood in the center of the camp, and started whistling... an eerie tune, with an unearthly melody. Although our forces held no discernable line, each man was somehow in position to repel the enemy's first strike. Throughout this all, that haunting melody continued, and the battle seemed to mimic the strange rhythms of the tune.[PARAGRAPH:1]The moment passed, and the song faded, but by the time it did, every one of our men was on his feet and fighting, and the whole of the enemy's first wave lay dead or dying.[PARAGRAPH:1]- Excerpt from the Diary of Anton Sandor, of the 3rd Infantry Legion
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Feind hatte uns beinahe erreicht und noch immer war niemand im Lager vorbereitet. Unsere Späher hatten versagt und der Feind würde uns in wenigen Augenblicken erreichen. Soldaten griffen in rasender Vorbereitungswut nach ihren Waffen. Noch immer war der Adept, der als Unterstützung entsandt war, seltsam abwesend.Er stand einfach nur in der Mitte des Lagers und begann zu flüstern...ein unheimliches Geräusch, mit einer Melodie nicht von dieser Welt. Ich nahm an dass er irre wurde, aber die Laute wurde intensiver, lauter als ein Mensch sie erzeugen konnte. Im nächsten Augenblick erfasste mich ein seltsamer Impuls und warf nich nach vorne um dem gegnerischen Angriff zu begegnen. Um mich herum sah ich meine Verbündeten, alle willkürlich verstreut...doch dann trafen sich beide Fronten und es geschah etwas seltsames. Obwohl wir keine erkennbare Linie bildeten, war doch jeder Mann in Position um den ersten Schlag des Feindes zurückzuschlagen. Trotz unserer vollständigen Verwirrtheit, und dem Fehlen jedweder Planung oder Vorbereitung betrat nicht ein feindlicher Soldat unser Lager. Während aller Ereignisse blieb die gespenstische Melodie erhalten und die Schlacht schien die seltsamen Rhythmen der Töne zu imitieren.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die Zeit verging und die Töne ließen nach und jedes Mal wenn sie schwächer wurden, stand jeder unserer Männer auf seinen Füßen und kämpfte, sodass die gesamte erste Welle des Feindes tot war oder im sterben lag.[PARAGRAPH:1] - Ausug aus dem Tagebuch Anton Sandors, 3. Infantrielegion
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]The enemy was almost upon us, and nobody in the camp was prepared. Our scouts had failed us, and we would be set upon in moments. Soldiers grabbed up their weapons in frantic preparation. Yet in the midst of all this the adept sent to assist us was strangely passive. He simply stood in the center of the camp, and started whistling... an eerie tune, with an unearthly melody. I took him for mad, but then the sound intensified, becoming louder than a human could possibly produce. In the next moment, a strange impulse came upon me, drawing me forward to meet the enemy charge. All around, I could see my allies, scattered about at random... but then both sides met... and something strange happened. Although our forces held no discernable line, each man was somehow in position to repel the enemy's first strike. Despite our total confusion, and the lack of any kind of preparation or planning, not a single enemy soldier entered the camp. Throughout this all, that haunting melody continued, and the battle seemed to mimic the strange rhythms of the tune.[PARAGRAPH:1]The moment passed, and the song faded, but by the time it did, every one of our men was on his feet and fighting, and the whole of the enemy's first wave lay dead or dying.[PARAGRAPH:1]- Excerpt from the Diary of Anton Sandor, of the 3rd Infantry Legion

TEXT.English: [TAB]The forest was bleak and silent, E-lin was overcome with grief. He heard stories of a dark place deep in the forests, but couldn't imagine such desolation. Twisted branches, rotten fruits, and decayed bodies covered the floor. The lake was black and greasy. He cried as an aura of sorrow crushed his heart. He cursed to the skies in agony, as promises of revenge were muttered. He would not be able to save this sacred woods, but nothing would be able to save the one who did this.
TEXT.French: [TAB]The forest was bleak and silent, E-lin was overcome with grief. He heard stories of a dark place deep in the forests, but couldn't imagine such desolation. Twisted branches, rotten fruits, and decayed bodies covered the floor. The lake was black and greasy. He cried as an aura of sorrow crushed his heart. He cursed to the skies in agony, as promises of revenge were muttered. He would not be able to save this sacred woods, but nothing would be able to save the one who did this.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Wald war kahl und ruhig und E-Lin war von Kummer erfüllt. Er hörte Geschichten von einem dunklen Ort tief in den Wäldern, aber er konnte sich solch einen trostlosen Ort nicht vorstellen. Zerbrochene Zweige, verrottete Früchte und verfallene Körper bedeckten den Boden. Der See war schwarz und trüb. Er schrie, als eine Aura von Kummer sein Herz umfasste. In seinen Qualen verfluchte er den Himmel und schwor Rache. Er würde nicht in der Lage sein die heiligen Wälder zu retten, aber nichts konnte den beschützen der dafür verantwortlich war.

TEXT.English: [TAB]"Come to me......[PARAGRAPH:1]Bring your sword, bring your wife,[PARAGRAPH:1]bring adoration, bring me your life.[PARAGRAPH:1]You are mine, fall in line, [PARAGRAPH:1]only in death will you wake.[PARAGRAPH:1]Cattle and Swine, I will dine[PARAGRAPH:1]on your mind, honey and cake.[PARAGRAPH:1]never to cease, never to end,[PARAGRAPH:1]never to question, always to bend.[PARAGRAPH:1]Come to me...."[PARAGRAPH:2]-Whispers of Mindbender Chlototh the Wicked.

TEXT.German: "Komm zu mir......[PARAGRAPH:1]Reich her das Schwert, dein Weib sollst geben,[PARAGRAPH:1]fall auf die Knie, schenk mir dein Leben.[PARAGRAPH:1]Reih dich gleich ein, bist mein im Nu[PARAGRAPH:1]im Tod erst wirst erwachen du.[PARAGRAPH:1]Und speisen wir von Blut und Schwein,[PARAGRAPH:1]wird's Milch und Honig für dich sein.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ohne Rast und ohne Ende,[PARAGRAPH:1]ohne Fragen, ohne Wende[PARAGRAPH:1]Komm zu mir......"[PARAGRAPH:2]Geflüster des Schamanen, Chlototh dem Irren

TEXT.English: [TAB]Baptism is common to many religions but the Overlord Cultists hold the victim underwater past immersion, through the struggle, and until the floating body has become filled and heavy with the sacred waters. Then they let go and the corpse rises as the undead Drown.[PARAGRAPH:1]This ability upgrades a Warrior into the Drown. It can only be used if the players state religion is Octopus Overlords and if the warrior is in a city with a Temple of the Overlords building.

It can only be used if the players state religion is Octopus Overlords and if the warrior is in a city with a Temple of the Overlords building.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Taufe ist in vielen Religionen üblich, doch die Okkultisten der Tiefe halten das Opfer länger als erlaubt unter Wasser, bis der schwimmende Körper mit dem heiligen Wasser gefüllt ist. Dann ersteht die Leiche als untoter Ertränkter wieder auf.[PARAGRAPH:1]Diese Fähigkeit wertet einen Krieger zu einem Ertränkten auf. Sie kann nur benutzt werden, wenn die Staatsreligion Schatten der Tiefe ist und wenn sich der Krieger in einer Stadt mit einem Tempel der Schatten der Tiefe befindet.

TEXT.English: [TAB]"Although the making of a proper Spellstaff is a task best left to the most skilled of enchanters, it is possible to do it with less effort if one has the proper materials. You must begin with a stout branch of sacred wood, gathered by the light of the full moon from an ancient and holy forest. You should then carve the staff, taking care to leave an open slot to place a gem. Once carved, you must then immediately bathe the staff in the blood of a powerful magical creature... I recommend Kraken's blood. Once this is done, you can insert the gem. The gem must be of at least the width of the staff, preferably an amethyst or sapphire. Once you've done all these things, return your nearly-complete staff to the Enchantment node, placing it at the focal point of power. Leave it there for a week, during which time you should attend it closely, focusing your powers on the First Principle of Enchantment. Once you've done that, bring the staff to me, and I will judge whether you have done the task correctly."[PARAGRAPH:1]The students nodded and muttered agreement before dispersing. After the last had left, however, the High Magus of the Mage Guild frowned at the Archmage in obvious disapproval.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Why did you tell them that? You know perfectly well that none of that has anything to do with making a spellstaff."[PARAGRAPH:1]The Archmage shrugged.[PARAGRAPH:1]"True... but I've always wanted a staff like that."

Once you've done that, bring the staff to me, and I will judge whether you have done the task correctly."[PARAGRAPH:1]The students nodded and muttered agreement before dispersing. After the last had left, however, the High Magus of the Mage Guild frowned at the Archmage in obvious disapproval.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Why did you tell them that? You know perfectly well that none of that has anything to do with making a spellstaff."[PARAGRAPH:1]The Archmage shrugged.[PARAGRAPH:1]"True... but I've always wanted a staff like that."
TEXT.German: [TAB]"Obwohl die Herstellung eines ordentlichen Zauberstabs eine Aufgabe ist, die am besten dem Begabtesten unter den Verzauberern überlassen wird, ist es möglich sie deutlich weniger aufwändig herzustellen, wenn man die richtigen Zutaten besitzt. Man muss mit einem starken Ast aus heiligem Holz beginnen, geschlagen beim Schein des Vollmonds in einem uralten und heiligen Wald. Dann sollte man den Stab, unter Rücksichtnahme eines freien Platzes für das einsetzen eines Edelsteins, schnitzen. Ist der Stab geschnitzt, so muss er im Blut einer mächtigen magischen Kreatur gebadet werden. Ich empfehle dafür das Blut eines Kraken. Ist dies getan, kann der Edelstein eingesetzt werden. Der Stein muss wenigstens den Durchmesser des Stabs haben und ich empfehle die Verwendung eines Ametysts oder eines Saphirs. Sind all diese Dinge erledigt, so bringt den fast fertigen Stab zurück zum Manabrunnen der Verzauberung und legt ihn auf den Bündelpunkt der Macht. Lasst ihn dort für eine Woche liegen und seid oft zugegen, konzentriert euch auf das erste Prinzip der Verzauberung. Habt ihr all das vollbracht, so kehrt zu mir zurück und ich will bewerten ob ihr diese Aufgabe zu meiner Zufriedenheit gelöst habt. "[PARAGRAPH:1] Die Schüler nickten mit den Köpfen und äußerten ihre Zustimmung bevor sie verschwanden. Nachdem der letzte gegangen war wandt sich der Hohe Magus der Magiergilde in offensichtlicher Ablehnung dem Erzmagier zu.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Warum habt Ihr ihnen dies gesagt? Ihr wisst ganz genau, dass keine dieser Aufgaben etwas mit der Herstellung eines Zauberstabs zu tun hat."[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Erzmagier zuckte mit den Schultern .[PARAGRAPH:1]"Das ist wahr...aber ich wollte schon immer einen solchen Stab."

TEXT.English: An offensive spell which can bombard walls and cause collateral damage. Whilst not especially strong, a [LINK=UNIT_FIREBALL]fireball[\LINK] can often be used to soften up foes before the main body of troops attack. For increased effectiveness, build the [LINK=BUILDING_TOWER_OF_THE_ELEMENTS]Tower of Elements[\LINK]

TEXT.English: [TAB]"Yes it's POSSIBLE to do it without magic. It's also possible to ride a donkey and use a flowerpot for a helmet!"[PARAGRAPH:2]-Dorian Fire-eyes, Amurite city guard captain
TEXT.French: [TAB]"Oui, c'est POSSIBLE de le faire sans magie. Il est aussi possible de chevaucher un âne et d'utiliser un pot de fleur comme casque !"[PARAGRAPH:2]- Dorian Yeux-de-Feu, Capitaine de la Garde Urbaine Amurite
TEXT.German: [TAB]"Ja, es ist MÖGLICH, es ohne Magie zu tun. Es ist auch möglich, Esel anstatt Pferde zu reiten und einen Blumentopf als Helm zu benutzen!"[PARAGRAPH:2] - Dorian Feuerauge, Kapitän der Stadtwache der Amurite
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]"Yes it's POSSIBLE to do it without magic. It's also possible to ride a donkey and use a flowerpot for a helmet!"[PARAGRAPH:2]-Dorian Fire-eyes, Amurite city guard captain
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]"Yes it's POSSIBLE to do it without magic. It's also possible to ride a donkey and use a flowerpot for a helmet!"[PARAGRAPH:2]-Dorian Fire-eyes, Amurite city guard captain

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Overlord priestess stood quietly on the seashore, her long flowing robe dancing in the storm. She could have done this anywhere on land, but nowhere did it feel as real and invigorating as by the sea, by the storm.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Oh mighty masters, hear my call", she spread out her arms and raised her eyes upwards, towards the storm rising above the sea. "My body and mind are yours to command, my sanity but a tool at your bidding. Honor my sacrifice to you, and grant me the sight of your servant." Intoning the words, she could feel the might that lurked deep below the waves, the ancient and inhuman power. The overwhelming sensation was enough to blind her to the living world and threw her mind into a deep blackness that contained only the ever-stormy nightmares of the overlords. In the horrible, chaotic maelstrom of bizarre sensations and feelings never meant for mortal eyes, she forced her will, shaped in her head the image of a twisted, many-eyed octopus. As she concentrated on the vision, two of the fish's eyes were torn out of its head in a slimly plop. They stared at the chaos around them and floated in the air, untouched by the raging water and wind.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Your eyes shall be mine", she said in a dry whisper, reached out for the eyes and closed her fist around them. As she felt the large, slimy things against her skin, the storm in her mind quieted and she once again stood on the shore.[PARAGRAPH:2]"And my eyes they will be", she finished, now seeing with two pairs of eyes as she opened her fists to reveal the gifts of her gods. She said nothing more as she lowered her hands and willed the eyes to rise up in the air, go out and spy upon the enemies of the Overlords.

She said nothing more as she lowered her hands and willed the eyes to rise up in the air, go out and spy upon the enemies of the Overlords.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Priesterin der Tiefe stand ruhig am Meeresstrand, ihre lange geschmeidige Robe tanzte im Wind. Sie hätte dies überall an Land tun können, doch nirgendwo fühlte es sich so wirklich und so stärkend an als am Meer, während des Sturms.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Oh ihr mächtigen Herren, hört meinen Ruf!". Sie breitete ihre Arme aus und blickte gen Himmel, auf den Sturm der über dem Meer heranzog. "Mein Körper und meine Seele sind bereit für euren Befehl, mein Verstand ist nur ein Werkzeug, wenn ihr dies wünscht. Ehrt mein Opfer an euch und gewährt mir die Sicht eures Dieners." Während sie sprach konnte sie die Macht spüren, die tief unter den Wellen lauerte, diese mächtige und unmenschliche Kraft. Dieses überwältigende Wunder reichte aus, um sie für die irdische Welt zu blenden und warf ihren Geist in tiefe Dunkelheit, in der es nur die ewig stürmischen Albträume der Schatten der Tiefe gab. In diesem schrecklichen und chaotischen Strudel von seltsamen Ereignissen und Gefühlen, die nie für die Augen Sterblicher bestimmt waren, bezwang sie ihren Willen und brannte sich das Bildnis eines vieläugigen, gewundenen Oktopus ein. Als sie sich auf die Vision konzentrierte, wurden zwei der Augen aus dem Kopf des Fischs mit einem schleimigen Plop herausgerissen. Sie starrten auf das Chaos um sie herum und stiegen dann in den Himmel auf, unberührt vom tobenden Wasser und dem Wind.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Eure Augen sollen die meinen sein" flüsterte sie trocken, griff nach den Augen und schloss sie in ihre Faust. Als sie diese großen schleimigen Dinger an ihrer Haut spürte, beruhigte sich der Sturm in ihrem Kopf und sie stand wieder am Strand.[PARAGRAPH:2]"Und meine Augen werden sie sein" endigte sie und sie sah nun mit zwei Paar Augen, als sie ihre Faust öffnete um die Geschenke der Götter zu bestaunen. Sie sagte nichts mehr als sie ihre Hände senkte und es den Augen gewährte in den Himmel zu steigen um die Feinde der Schatten zu beobachten.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Properties that avail a small benefit alone can often yield a fantastic increase when in concert with certain other properties. Nature, while inventive, lacks true imagination in this regard, but to an... Unencumbered mind, the possibilities are intriguing. A tigers teeth give a last ditch weapon, a hawk's eyes enhance an archer, and a bear's strength and fur could give any soldier an advantage over the northern savages.[PARAGRAPH:1]Furthermore, with the proper supplication to our masters, the problem of unwilling subjects is easily overcome...[PARAGRAPH:2]From High Priest Nyarlat Hotep's "Musings on Perfection"
TEXT.French: [TAB]Properties that avail a small benefit alone can often yield a fantastic increase when in concert with certain other properties. Nature, while inventive, lacks true imagination in this regard, but to an... Unencumbered mind, the possibilities are intriguing. A tigers teeth give a last ditch weapon, a hawk's eyes enhance an archer, and a bear's strength and fur could give any soldier an advantage over the northern savages.[PARAGRAPH:1]Furthermore, with the proper supplication to our masters, the problem of unwilling subjects is easily overcome...[PARAGRAPH:2]From High Priest Nyarlat Hotep's "Musings on Perfection"
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eigenschaften, die alleine nur einen kleinen Bonus bringen, können manchmal unglaublich nützlich sein, wenn sie mit bestimmten anderen kombiniert werden. Die Natur ist zwar einfallsreich, doch nur bis zu einem bestimmten Punkt. Doch für einen freien Verstand sind die Möglichkeiten verblüffend. Der Zahn eines Tigers ist ein Retter in der Not, Adleraugen kommen einem Bogenschützen zu gute, die Stärke und das Fell eines Bären geben den Soldaten einen Vorteil gegenüber den Wilden aus dem Norden.[PARAGRAPH:1] Außerdem ist das Problem unwilliger Subjekte mit der richtigen Demut unserer Herren gegenüber leicht zu überwinden.[PARAHRAPH:2] Aus Hohepriester Nyarlat Hoteps "Grübeleien über Perfektion"

TEXT.English: [TAB]We gazed at the ruins of our city, and around it the slaughtered herds and salted fields. The crows circled overhead eagerly, and their stench of the scavengers feast reached insidiously into our noses.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Well," the commander said at last, "things won't be getting any worse, boys."
TEXT.French: [TAB]We gazed at the ruins of our city, and around it the slaughtered herds and salted fields. The crows circled overhead eagerly, and their stench of the scavengers feast reached insidiously into our noses.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Well," the commander said at last, "things won't be getting any worse, boys."
TEXT.German: [TAB]Wir starrten fassungslos auf die Ruinen unserer Stadt und auf die geschlachteten Herden, die brachen Felder drumherum. Die Krähen drehten weit über unseren köpfen ihre Kreise, und der Gestank dieses - für Aasfresser - Festmahls drang uns bald in die Nasen.[PARAGRAPH:1]" Nun gut, Jungs," sagte der Kommandant schließlich, "schlimmer kann es nicht mehr kommen."

TEXT.English: [TAB]Ximinez: So you think you are strong because you can survive the soft cushions. Well, we shall see. Biggles! Put her in the Comfy Chair![PARAGRAPH:1][They roughly push her into the Comfy Chair][PARAGRAPH:1]Ximinez [with a cruel leer]: Now - you will stay in the Comfy Chair until lunch time, with only a cup of coffee at eleven. [aside, to Biggles] Is that really all it is?[PARAGRAPH:1]Biggles: Yes, lord.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ximinez: I see. I suppose we make it worse by shouting a lot, do we? Confess, woman. Confess! Confess! Confess! Confess[PARAGRAPH:1]Biggles: I confess![PARAGRAPH:1]Ximinez: Not you![PARAGRAPH:1]

TEXT.German: [TAB]Ximinez: Du denkst also, du bist stark, weil du die weichen Polster überstehen kannst. Na, wir werden sehen. Biggels! [nebenbei zu Biggles] ist das wirklich alles?[PARAGRAPH:1]Biggels: Ja, Herr.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ximinez: Verstehe. Ich schlage vor, wir machen es so schlimm wie möglich, indem wir viel umher schreien, oder? TEXT.English: [TAB]"What reason is there to wait? If you and I are to dance, why do we remain still? If you and I are to kill, what stays our hand? Why you have come to this place, is irrelevant. When you move on, is inconsequential. Whose illusions could you prefer, when you might create your own? Why play at life, when you could live it instead?"[PARAGRAPH:2]-High priest Sunn Lao to his would-be assassin, his student thereafter.
TEXT.French: [TAB]"What reason is there to wait? If you and I are to dance, why do we remain still? If you and I are to kill, what stays our hand? Why you have come to this place, is irrelevant. When you move on, is inconsequential. Whose illusions could you prefer, when you might create your own? Why play at life, when you could live it instead?"[PARAGRAPH:2]-High priest Sunn Lao to his would-be assassin, his student thereafter.
TEXT.German: [TAB]"Welchen Grund gibt es, zu warten? Wenn du und ich da sind, um zu Tanzen, warum stehen wir dann noch still? Wenn du und ich existieren, um zu töten, wie könnten wir unsere Hand dann zurückhalten? Warum du hierher gekommen bist, ist unwichtig. Wessen Illusion könntest du vorziehen, wenn du doch deine eigene schaffen kannst? Warum mit dem leben spielen, wenn du es doch leben kannst?[PARAGRAPH:2] - Hohepriester Sunn Lao zu seinem Beinahe-Attentäter, der später zu seinem Schüler wurde.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]"What reason is there to wait? If you and I are to dance, why do we remain still? If you and I are to kill, what stays our hand? Why you have come to this place, is irrelevant. When you move on, is inconsequential. Whose illusions could you prefer, when you might create your own? Why play at life, when you could live it instead?"[PARAGRAPH:2]-High priest Sunn Lao to his would-be assassin, his student thereafter.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The watch commander burst into the governor's bedroom. He stopped, shocked, by the sight of the governors empty bed. Had everyone sleeping in the city disappeared? But a light snoring from the couch shook him from his fear and he noticed the governor packed under a thick blanket on his long couch.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Sir Governor!"[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan wheeled both his legs, as if he was trying to run away as his body bolted from sleep to wakefulness. For a confused second he stared at the elaborate print of the couch back as the commander rattled on.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Caris Tonie is missing! His parents say that he went to bed early and when they went to check on him just after last bell his room was empty."[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan forced himself up into a sitting position and rubbed his eyes. The watch commander was young and easily excited.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Commander, calm down. Caris is just a boy, but he is also our most promising prophet. Certainly he could foresee anything bad that might happen to him. He probably snuck out to meet his friends or some girl."[PARAGRAPH:1]The commander nodded, unwilling to argue with the Governor, but still fearful.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Is there more commander?" Johan asked.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Yes sir, there was an elven trader who arrived in the city a few days ago. He was staying in a boarding house not far from the Tonie's home. He is also missing, as well as his supplies and horse."[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan paled, "Elven? Do you mean Ljosalfar or Svartalfar?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"He said he was from Evermeet, but we checked with the ambassador and they don't know him."[PARAGRAPH:1]They both stood silently imagining the life of the talented boy they both knew in the hands of the Svartalfar. Johan broke the silence.[PARAGRAPH:1]"He has been kidnapped."[PARAGRAPH:1]The watch commander nodded, "I believe so sir, I will put together a party."[PARAGRAPH:1]"That hardly seems like an appropriate response."[PARAGRAPH:1]The two stared dumbfounded at each other, "No sir, a search party."[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan nodded, "Oh. Right away commander, we must get him back."
TEXT.French: [TAB]The watch commander burst into the governor's bedroom. He stopped, shocked, by the sight of the governors empty bed. Had everyone sleeping in the city disappeared? But a light snoring from the couch shook him from his fear and he noticed the governor packed under a thick blanket on his long couch.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Sir Governor!"[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan wheeled both his legs, as if he was trying to run away as his body bolted from sleep to wakefulness. For a confused second he stared at the elaborate print of the couch back as the commander rattled on.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Caris Tonie is missing! His parents say that he went to bed early and when they went to check on him just after last bell his room was empty."[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan forced himself up into a sitting position and rubbed his eyes. The watch commander was young and easily excited.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Commander, calm down. Caris is just a boy, but he is also our most promising prophet. Certainly he could foresee anything bad that might happen to him. He probably snuck out to meet his friends or some girl."[PARAGRAPH:1]The commander nodded, unwilling to argue with the Governor, but still fearful.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Is there more commander?" Johan asked.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Yes sir, there was an elven trader who arrived in the city a few days ago. He was staying in a boarding house not far from the Tonie's home. He is also missing, as well as his supplies and horse."[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan paled, "Elven? Do you mean Ljosalfar or Svartalfar?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"He said he was from Evermeet, but we checked with the ambassador and they don't know him."[PARAGRAPH:1]They both stood silently imagining the life of the talented boy they both knew in the hands of the Svartalfar. Johan broke the silence.[PARAGRAPH:1]"He has been kidnapped."[PARAGRAPH:1]The watch commander nodded, "I believe so sir, I will put together a party."[PARAGRAPH:1]"That hardly seems like an appropriate response."[PARAGRAPH:1]The two stared dumbfounded at each other, "No sir, a search party."[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan nodded, "Oh. Right away commander, we must get him back."
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Wachkommandant platzte in das Schlafzimmer des Gouverneurs. Er stoppte, geschockt vom Anblick des Gouverneurs leerem Bett. Sind all die Schlafenden in der Stadt verschwunden? Aber ein leichtes Schnarchen von der Couch befreite ihn von seiner Angst und er stellte fest, dass der Gouverneur verpackt unter einer dicken Decke, auf seiner langen Couch lag.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Herr Gouverneur!"[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan bewegte seine Beine, gerade so als ob er zu fliehen versuchte, als er schlagartig wach wurde. Für eine Schrecksekunde starrte er auf den kunstvoll aufwändigen Bezug der Couch, während der Kommandant schon losplapperte.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Caris Tonie wird vermisst! Seine Eltern berichten, dass er früh zu Bett ging und als sie kurz nach dem letzten Glockenläuten in sein Zimmer gingen, um nach dem Rechten zu sehen, war es leer."[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan zwang sich selbst in eine Sitzposition und rieb seine Augen. Der Wachkommandant war jung und leicht aufgeregt.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Kommandant, beruhigen sie sich. Caris ist nur ein Junge, aber er ist auch einer unserer vielversprechendsten Propheten. Sicherlich könnte er etwas schlechtes vorhersehen, das ihm selbst widerfahren könnte. Er ist wahrscheinlich hinausgeschlichen, um seine Freunde oder irgendein Mädchen zu treffen."[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Kommandant nickte, nicht gewillt mit dem Gouverneur zu diskutieren, aber immer noch besorgt.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gibt es sonst noch etwas, Kommandant?" fragte Johan.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Ja Herr, da war ein elfischer Händler, der vor ein paar Tagen in der Stadt eintraf. Er verweilte in einer Herberge, unweit des Hauses der Tonie's. Er wird auch vermisst, ebenso sein Gepäck und sein Pferd."[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan erblasste, "Elfisch? Meinen Sie damit Ljosalfar oder Svartalfar?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Er sagte, er sei von Evermeet, aber wir haben das beim Botschafter überprüft, die kennen ihn nicht."[PARAGRAPH:1]Beide standen regungslos da, erstarrt durch die schreckliche Vorstellung, dass das Leben des begabten Jungen, den sie beide kannten, nun in den Händen der Svartalfar sei. Johan brach die Stille.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Er wurde entführt."[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Wachkommandant nickte. "Das glaube ich auch, Herr, ich werde sogleich einen Trupp losschicken."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Dies entspricht wohl kaum einer angebrachten Erwiderung."[PARAGRAPH:1]Die beiden starrten sich gegenseitig verdutzt an. "Nein Herr, einen Suchtrupp."[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan nickte. "Oh. Auf der Stelle Kommandant, wir müssen ihn zurückbekommen."

But a light snoring from the couch shook him from his fear and he noticed the governor packed under a thick blanket on his long couch.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Sir Governor!"[PARAGRAPH:1]Johan wheeled both his legs, as if he was trying to run away as his body bolted from sleep to wakefulness. TEXT.English: [TAB]If the gods desire one thing above all else, what is it? Allegiance? Worship? Ethical codes? Easily forgotten. Their primary concern is their sovereignty, as our rulers' sovereignty is theirs. The gods resent like no other those who are able to subvert the rules that they have written into the universe, and the most utterly impartial law of creation is death. Remember this whenever you encounter one who has found a loophole in this law, the undead.
TEXT.French: [TAB]If the gods desire one thing above all else, what is it? Allegiance? Worship? Ethical codes? Easily forgotten. Their primary concern is their sovereignty, as our rulers' sovereignty is theirs. The gods resent like no other those who are able to subvert the rules that they have written into the universe, and the most utterly impartial law of creation is death. Remember this whenever you encounter one who has found a loophole in this law, the undead.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Was begehren die Götter am meisten? Loyalität? Verehrung? Moralische Regeln? All das gerät schnell in Vergessenheit. Was ihnen am meisten Bedeutet, ist Herrschaft, so wie wir Herren haben, haben unsere Herren die Götter als Herren. Sie verübeln es denen, die sich über die Regeln, die sie dem Universum auferlegt haben, hinwegsetzen können. Und das unbestritten unabänderlichste Gesetz ist das der Schöpfung und des Todes. Erinnere dich daran, wann immer du auf jene triffst, die ein Schlupfloch in diesem Gesetz gefunden haben - die Untoten.

TEXT.English: [TAB]"I knew what I had to do. The major was hardly the type of man that soldiers would follow on instinct. His father was an affluent merchant who, knowing his second son would be a much better heir to the business, had bought his first son a commission as a lieutenant. By some small oversight, his transfers always seemed to turn into promotions and he now stood on the eve of battle with an entire company at his command. I could tell the major knew nothing of the powers of the Overlord's army that lay before him. As he turned to address his men I began my incantation. If, by some miracle, we are victorious, the survivors will have grand stories of brave fallen soldiers. In any case, there will be none who succumb to the enemy's tricks this day."
TEXT.French: [TAB]"I knew what I had to do. The major was hardly the type of man that soldiers would follow on instinct. His father was an affluent merchant who, knowing his second son would be a much better heir to the business, had bought his first son a commission as a lieutenant. By some small oversight, his transfers always seemed to turn into promotions and he now stood on the eve of battle with an entire company at his command. I could tell the major knew nothing of the powers of the Overlord's army that lay before him. As he turned to address his men I began my incantation. If, by some miracle, we are victorious, the survivors will have grand stories of brave fallen soldiers. In any case, there will be none who succumb to the enemy's tricks this day."
TEXT.German: [TAB]"Ich wusste was ich zu tun hatte. Der Major war kaum der Typ, dem Soldaten instinktiv folgen würden. Sein Vater war ein wohlhabender Händler, der wusste dass sein zweiter Sohn ein besserer Nachfolger wäre und so seinem Sohn den Rang eines Leutnants kaufte. Durch seltsame Kurzsicht wandelten sich seine Versetzungen immer zu Beförderungen so stand er nun am Beginn einer Schlacht mit einer kompletten Kompanie unter seinem Befehl. Ich hätte schwören können, dass der Major nicht von den Mächten der Armee der Schatten aus der Tiefe wusste, die ihm gegenüber stand. Als er sich umdrehte um die Soldaten einzuschwören begann ich mit meiner Beschwörung. Falls wir, durch irgend ein Wunder, siegreich sein sollten, werden die Überlebenden großartige Geschichten über gefallene Soldaten parat haben. Aber auf jeden Fall wird am heutigen Tage niemand den Tricks der Feinde erliegen."

TEXT.English: [TAB]"My lady... the results of your experiment. Nearly all of them... twisted beyond comprehension..."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Those who weren't cut out for this shouldn't have volunteered," the voice of the priestess was as harsh and merciless as the young man's was quivering. "The ones who perish here wouldn't have survived combat anyway."[PARAGRAPH:1]The men and the women who'd volunteered lay prone on the open field, all covered by monstrous deformities. One seemed to have had all the blood sucked out of him, another man's testicles had grown so huge they had crushed his toes under their weight. The priestess was walking among them, inspecting each before moving on. Clearly, it seemed, one of the ones who wasn't cut out for it was the aide she'd been assigned.[PARAGRAPH:1]"But my lady," he tried one more time, flinching away his gaze from the man whose bowels had exploded rather violently out of his stomach, "There wasn't anything wrong with these troops, that's why you chose them... they would have made excellent soldiers had not..."[PARAGRAPH:1]"And you would make an excellent Drown if you did not shut up," the priestess replied coldly, finally quieting the aide. She stopped in front of one of her test subjects, pausing to take a closer look. The elven woman had been pretty once, but no stretch of the imagination would let you use that word of her anymore. Any fat she might have had was muscle now, and all the muscle she had was grown large enough to stretch and tear away the skin that had once covered it. Her eyes were bulging out of her head, the expanding tissue having forced them out of their sockets-but despite everything, she eyed the priestess with an air of wary satisfaction.[PARAGRAPH:1]"I think this... is exactly what we need," for the first time today, a smile slowly appeared on the priestess's lips. Her eyes glowing, she turned to the aide, joyous laughter in her voice. "I knew the Overlords would not forsake us! They have gifted some of us inhuman strength, enough to take down all of our foes. Find the others who look like this, they're the ones we want."[PARAGRAPH:1]"And... the others?" the man slowly asked.[PARAGRAPH:1]"The others? Oh," the priestess shrugged, having entirely forgotten about the failures already, "I don't think they can be made into Drown anymore, can they? It really doesn't matter, do what you want with them." She turned away from the aide, smiling and looking at the elven woman with love and adoration in her eyes.[PARAGRAPH:1]"You are so pretty that way, my dear. I'm so glad you made it."

She turned away from the aide, smiling and looking at the elven woman with love and adoration in her eyes.[PARAGRAPH:1]"You are so pretty that way, my dear. I'm so glad you made it."
TEXT.German: [TAB]"Herrin ... die Ergebnisse ihres Experiments. Nahe zu alle ... mutierten jenseits aller Vorstellungskraft..." [PARAGRAPH:1]"Jene, die dafür nicht vorgesehen waren hätten sich nicht freiwillig melden sollen," die Stimme der Priesterin war herb und erbarmungslos, so dass der junge Mann schauderte. "Wer hierbei verreckt ist hätte in der Schlacht eh nicht überlebt."[PARAGRAPH:1]Die Männer und Frauen, die sich freiwillig meldeten lagen bäuchlings auf dem offenen Feld, alle abscheulich deformiert. Einem schien das gesamte Blut ausgesaugt worden zu sein, die Hoden eines anderen sind so stark angeschwollen, dass seine Zehen unter dem Gewicht brachen. Die Priesterin ging zwischen ihnen hindurch und prüfte jeden bevor sie sich weiterbewegte. Es schien deutlich, dass einer der nicht vorgesehenen der ihr zugeteilte Berater war.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Aber meine Dame," versuchte er erneut, vor dem Blick des Mannes zurückweichend, dessen Eingeweide geradezu aus seinem Bauch heraus explodiert sind, Mit diesen Truppen war nichts verkehrt, deswegen habt ihr sie ausgewählt... sie wären exzellente Soldaten geworden wären sie nicht..."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Und Ihr würdet einen exzellenten Ertränkten abgeben, wenn Ihr nicht das Maul haltet," entgegnete die Priesterin kalt während sie ihren Berater für immer ruhig stellte. Sie stoppte vor einer ihrer Versuchspersonen und hielt inne um sie genauer zu untersuchen. Die Elfenfrau war einmal schön, doch keine Dehnung dieser Vorstellung würde einen dazu bringen, dieses Wort über sie jetzt noch zu sagen. Jedes Fett, dass sie einst hatte waren nun Muskeln und all ihre Muskeln sind genug gewachsen um die Haut zu zerreißen, die sie einst bedeckt hatte. Ihre Augen quellten aus ihrem Kopf, das ausgedehnte Gewebe zwang sie aus ihren Höhlen - doch trotz allem beäugte sie die Priesterin mit einer Prise argwöhnischer Befriedigung.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Ich denke dies... ist genau das was wir brauchen," zum ersten Mal an diesem Tag umspielte ein Lächeln die Lippen der Priesterin. Ihre Augen glühten, sie drehte sich zu ihrem Berater mit einem freudigen Lachen in ihrer Stimme. "Ich wusste, die Schatten würden uns nicht im Stich lassen! Sie haben einigen von uns eine unmenschliche Stärke geschenkt, genug um all unsere Feinde zu besiegen. Finde alle, die aussehen wie diese, sie sind diejenigen die ich will."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Und... die anderen?" fragte der Mann langsam. [PARAGRAPH:1]"Die anderen? Oh", die Priesterin zuckte mit den Achseln, die Misserfolge hatte sie schon völlig vergessen, "Ich denke sie können nicht mehr zu Ertränkten gemacht werden, oder?? Es ist nun egal, macht mit ihnen was ihr wollt." Sie drehte sich um, lächelte und schaute die Elfenfrau mit Liebe und Bewunderung in ihren Augen an. [PARAGRAPH:1]"Auf diese Weise bist du so hübsch, meine Liebe. Ich bin so froh, dass du es geschafft hast."

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Forces peace between the player and all other civilizations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Halves the Armageddon Counter
TEXT.French: Le lanceur du sort se sacrifie pour obtenir la paix entre sa civilisation et toutes les autres
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Der Zaubernde opfert sich selbst für den Frieden zwischen Euch und allen anderen Zivilisationen und halbiert den Armagedonzähler
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Forces peace between the player and all other civilizations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Halves the Armageddon Counter
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Forces peace between the player and all other civilizations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Halves the Armageddon Counter

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Does fire damage to all units in a single tile[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Targets the tile with the most enemy units within range
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]endommage toutes les unités d'une case avec des dégâts de Feu[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Vise la case à portée avec le plus d'unités ennemies
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Richtet Schaden bei allen Einheiten auf dem gewählten Geländefeld an.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Zielt auf das Geländefeld mit den meisten gegnerischen Einheiten in Reichweite.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Does fire damage to all units in a single tile[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Targets the tile with the most enemy units within range
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Does fire damage to all units in a single tile[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Targets the tile with the most enemy units within range

TEXT.English: [TAB]When the messenger brought word that the Lanun refused our demand to surrender, the High Inquisitor sighed sadly, then ordered our army back from the walls. The commanders protested this apparent retreat, but the High Inquisitor replied, "Wait, and see." He climbed a hill which overlooked the pirate raiders' seaport, and began to pray.[PARAGRAPH:1]It started slowly, thin streamers of smoke rising from the rooftops, but quickly hungry tongues of flame were licking the sky, rising higher and higher. Within a minute, the entire town was on fire, and still the flames rose, spinning with increasing speed about a central axis. The great pillar of fire stretched to the zenith, spinning like some hellish cyclone of flame-even a quarter-mile from the walls, we could feel the wind created as it sucked up the surrounding air into itself.[PARAGRAPH:1]The most horrible part came after the pillar collapsed and dissolved. That's when it started to snow-except it wasn't snow, not at midsummer. It the ashes of the town and its inhabitants, drawn up by the pillar of fire, and scattered for a half-mile round about what once had been a thriving seaport, and was now a great crematorium.[PARAGRAPH:1]That was when I started to have doubts about serving the Order.[PARAGRAPH:2]-From A Diary of the Lanun Campaigns by Kell Magoran

TEXT.German: [TAB]Als der Bote uns mit der Nachricht erreichte, dass die Lanun die verlangte Kapitulation verweigerten, entfuhr dem Hohen Inquisitor ein trauriges Seufzen. Dann befahl er den Rückzug unserer Armee von der Stadtmauer. Die Befehlshaber protestierten gegen diesen scheinbaren Rückzug, doch der Hohe Inquisitor antwortete: "Warte und schau zu." Er bestieg einen Hügel, von welchem aus die gesamte Hafenstadt der Piratenräuber zu sehen war und begann zu beten.[PARAGRAPH:1]Es fing langsam und harmlos an - nur ein paar Rauchschleier, welche sich über den Dächern erhoben. Doch all zu bald wuchsen sie zu hungrigen Feuerzungen heran, welche den Himmel leckten. Sie wuchsen höher und höher und binnen einer Minute stand die gesamte Stadt in Flammen. Die Flammen wuchsen weiter, während sie um ihre eigene Achse zu kreisen begannen. Eine Säule aus Feuer erstreckte sich nun zum Zenit, sich drehend wie ein infernalischer Wirbelsturm der Flammen. Wir konnten den Wind spüren, während es die umgebende Luft in sich aufsog.[PARAGRAPH:1]Doch der schrecklichste Teil kam, nachdem die Säule kollabierte und sich auflöste. Dies war der Zeitpunkt, als es anfing zu schneien - nur war es kein Schnee, nicht im Mitsommer. Es war die Asche der Stadt und seiner Einwohner, empor gesogen von der Feuerseule und zerstreut in alle Richtungen bis zu einer halben Meile weit. Was einst eine blühende Hafenstadt war, war nun ein Krematorium.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dies war der Zeitpunkt, als mich erstmals Zweifel über meinen Dienst für die Weisung befielen.[PARAGRAPH:2] - Aus dem Tagebuch eines Hauptmanns der Lanun von Kell Magoran

TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Opfert die Einheit für die Schaffung einer Piratenbucht.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Allows the creation of a Pirate Cove improvement. Pirate coves can only be created on coast tiles and can't be built within 3 tiles of another cove. The work boat creating the Pirate cove must be alone on the tile to make it.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Permet la création d'un aménagement Crique Pirate. La Crique Pirate peut seulement être placée sur une case côtière, ne peut être construite à moins de trois cases d'une autre crique et nécessite la technologie Optique.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Erlaubt den Bau einer Piratenbucht. Sie können nur ein Küstenfeldern errichtet werden und nicht innerhalb dem Bereich von 3 Feldern um eine andere Piratenbucht. Der Arbeiter, der die Bucht erstellt, muss allein auf dem Feld sein.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Allows the creation of a Pirate Cove improvement. Pirate coves can only be created on coast tiles and can't be built within 3 tiles of another cove. The work boat creating the Pirate cove must be alone on the tile to make it.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Allows the creation of a Pirate Cove improvement. Pirate coves can only be created on coast tiles and can't be built within 3 tiles of another cove. The work boat creating the Pirate cove must be alone on the tile to make it.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Player must have Slave Trade vote passed in the Undercouncil to use this ability
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Le joueur doit avoir obtenu le Marché aux Esclaves par l'intermédiaire du Conseil Souterrain pour activer cette capacité
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Der Spieler muss einen Sklavenhandel, per Abstimmung im Geheimen Rat, etabliert haben, um diese Fähigkeit nutzen zu können.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Player must have Slave Trade vote passed in the Undercouncil to use this ability

TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Makes a unit into a barbarian unit

TEXT.English: [TAB]"The Confessor looked over at me condescendingly-I mean, kindly. He was always kind to me... and controlling. Him and the commander. Domineering holier-than-thou taskmaster, I'd like to... Why am I having these thoughts? Why do I long to thrust my blade between their shoulders? All of them... so much... hate..."[PARAGRAPH:2]Last entry in the journal of the third missing recruit from the 105th recon unit.
TEXT.French: [TAB]"The Confessor looked over at me condescendingly-I mean, kindly. He was always kind to me... and controlling. Him and the commander. Domineering holier-than-thou taskmaster, I'd like to... Why am I having these thoughts? Why do I long to thrust my blade between their shoulders? All of them... so much... hate..."[PARAGRAPH:2]Last entry in the journal of the third missing recruit from the 105th recon unit.
TEXT.German: [TAB]"Der Bekenner schaute mich herablassend an - ich meine freundlich. Er war immer nett zu mir ... und überwachte mich. Er und der Kommandant. Der tyrannische Ich-bin-etwas-besseres-Knechtmeister, Ich würde gerne ... Woher kommen diese Gedanken? Warum sehne ich mich danach meine Klinge zwischen ihre Schultern zu treiben? Ihnen allen ... so viel ... Hass..."[PARAGRAPH:2]Letzter Eintrag im Tagebuch des dritten vermissten Rekruten der 105. Aufklärungseinheit.

TEXT.English: [TAB]I loved my chosen: how then to face the day when she left me?[PARAGRAPH:1]So I cast upon her body a single spell-perhaps, to love her again.[PARAGRAPH:2]-Unknown Author "On the Various Applications of Necromancy"
TEXT.French: [TAB]I loved my chosen: how then to face the day when she left me?[PARAGRAPH:1]So I cast upon her body a single spell-perhaps, to love her again.[PARAGRAPH:2]-Unknown Author "On the Various Applications of Necromancy"
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ich liebte meine Auserwählte: Wie sollte ich den Tag durchstehen, an dem sie von mir ging?[PARAGRAPH:1]Also belegte ich ihren Körper mit einem einzigen Zauberspruch - vielleicht, um sie wieder lieben zu können [PARAGRAPH:2] - Unbekannter Autor: "Aus den mannigfaltigen Anwendungen der Nekromantie"
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I loved my chosen: how then to face the day when she left me?[PARAGRAPH:1]So I cast upon her body a single spell-perhaps, to love her again.[PARAGRAPH:2]-Unknown Author "On the Various Applications of Necromancy"

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Reading a page from the grimoire causes a random spell to trigger, and could kill the caster
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Lire une page du Grimoire engendrera un sort aléatoire, et peut tuer le lanceur
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Eine Seite aus dem Grimoire zu lesen verursacht einen zufälligen Zauber und kann den Zaubernden töten
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Reading a page from the grimoire causes a random spell to trigger, and could kill the caster
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Reading a page from the grimoire causes a random spell to trigger, and could kill the caster

TEXT.English: [TAB]"Whose life is unexpendable? Whose family is unimportant? Who among us would allow our brethren to die if we would only save our own skins? We are the best! We are the chosen! It is for us to fight! Look at your families, do you think you could tell them you cared not enough for them not to fight? Victory does not come from the soldier who is eager to fight, it comes from he who fights only that his children may live."[PARAGRAPH:2]- Captain Svorlen Majj, a recruitment speech on the eve of the 4th Lord's Crusade.
TEXT.French: [TAB]"Whose life is unexpendable? Whose family is unimportant? Who among us would allow our brethren to die if we would only save our own skins? We are the best! We are the chosen! It is for us to fight! Look at your families, do you think you could tell them you cared not enough for them not to fight? Victory does not come from the soldier who is eager to fight, it comes from he who fights only that his children may live."[PARAGRAPH:2]- Captain Svorlen Majj, a recruitment speech on the eve of the 4th Lord's Crusade.
TEXT.German: [TAB]"Wessen Lebenszeit ist abgelaufen? Wessen Familie ist nun unwichtig? Wer unter uns würde seinem Bruder den Tod überlassen, wenn wir dabei allein unsere eigene Haut retten würden? Wir sind die Besten! Wir sind die Auserwählten! Der Kampf ist unser Schicksal! Denkt an eure Familien. Glaubt ihr ihnen erzählen zu können, dass euch an ihnen nicht genug gelegen ist, um nicht zu kämpfen? Der Sieg wird nicht durch den Soldaten errungen, welche auf den Kampf versessen sind, sondern durch denjenigen, welche nur um das Leben seiner Kinder willen kämpfen."[PARAGRAPH:2] - Hauptmann Svorlen Majj, eine Rekrutierungsrede am Abend des vierten Kreuzzuges des Herrn

It is for us to fight! Look at your families, do you think you could tell them you cared not enough for them not to fight? Victory does not come from the soldier who is eager to fight, it comes from he who fights only that his children may live."[PARAGRAPH:2]- Captain Svorlen Majj, a recruitment speech on the eve of the 4th Lord's Crusade.

TEXT.English: Terrim watched in astonishment through his one good eye as the cuts down his legs began to knit themselves together. Small scratches vanished from his arms like shallow puddles evaporating in the sunlight. He felt a distinct tightening in his bowels as the gash across stomach closed. Then a burst of vitality spread through his right hand and, for the first time in several hours, he could feel his fingers. With an unpleasant pop his eyeball returned to it's socket. Sound was coming back to his ears, blurry and indistinct at first, but becoming clearer with each passing second.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"...Thank you, Nerys. Your incantations have been most useful. As always."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Any time," replied Nerys, failing to suppress a blush. "You know where to find me."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ready to begin once more, the torturer turned back to the rack, salivating, and Terrim's screams echoed around the chamber.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Gives all living units in the same plot the ability to Regenerate

TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Gibt allen lebenden Einheiten auf dem selben Geländefeld die Fähigkeit zur Regeneration
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Gives all living units in the same plot the ability to Regenerate
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Gives all living units in the same plot the ability to Regenerate

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Frees all units that are trapped in a cage

TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Befreit alle Einheiten die in Käfigen gefangen sind.

TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Frees all units that are trapped in a cage

TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Répare les golems, les unités navales et les armes de sièges.

TEXT.English: [TAB]"Gornbad Hurt."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Yes, I know Gornbad Hurt, look at you, you got really beat up out there."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Many orcs hurt Gornbad."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Orcs? Really, and this finely crafted sword I see lodged in your belly is of Orc-make is it?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad hit by many Orc-swords."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Orcs Don't wield... wait. What is this? Is...Is this a deer antler?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad was hungry"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad cant be hungry, Gornbad is a GOLEM!"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad thought after battle warriors get hungry, so Gornbad ate"[PARAGRAPH:1]"By shoving a deer down your gullet? That's not good for you, which explains the mess in here."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad Sorry"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Every time you wander away from the regiment you get damaged, you must stay with the others"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad saw orcs, has orders to smash orcs."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Those were Elves, stay away from them."[PARAGRAPH:1]"What difference?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Good point. ..Fine, Stay away from anything with sharp objects unless you're with your unit."[PARAGRAPH:1]-Techmage Errod and Gornbad the Iron Golem during a repair session.

TEXT.German: [TAB]"Gornbad verletzt."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Ja, ich weiß dass Gornbad verletzt ist. Schau dich nur an, du hast dort draußen wirklich viel einstecken müssen."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Ganzen Orks verletzen Gornbad."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Orks? Wirklich... Und dieses fein geschmiedete Schwert welches in deinem Bauch steckt ist orkischen Ursprungs, ja?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad gestochen von vielen Orkschwertern. [PARAGRAPH:1]"Orks haben keine... Warte. Was ist das? Ist...Ist das ein Hirschgeweih?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad war hungrig"[PARAGRAPH:2]Gornbad kann nicht hungrig sein, Gornbad ist ein GOLEM!"[PARAGRAPH1:]"Gornbad dachte, dass Krieger nach dem Kampf Hunger bekommen, also aß Gornbad"[PARAGRAPH:1] Indem du dir einen Hirsch den Rachen hinunter schiebst? Das ist nicht gut für dich und außerdem erklärt es diese Sauerei hier."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad leid tun"[PARAGRAPH:1]Jedes mal, wenn du umher wanderst und dich vom Regiment löst, wirst du beschädigt. Du musst bei den anderen bleiben"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad sah Orks, Gornbad wurde befohlen Orks zu zerschmettern."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Was Unterschied?"[PARAGRAPH:1]Gute Frage... Na schön, halt dich einfach von allen scharfen Gegenständen fern, sobald du nicht mehr deine Einheit um dich hast."[PARAGRAPH:1] - Technischer Magier Errod und Gornbad der Eisengolem während der Reparatur.

TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]"Gornbad Hurt."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Yes, I know Gornbad Hurt, look at you, you got really beat up out there."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Many orcs hurt Gornbad."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Orcs? Really, and this finely crafted sword I see lodged in your belly is of Orc-make is it?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad hit by many Orc-swords."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Orcs Don't wield... wait. What is this? Is...Is this a deer antler?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad was hungry"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad cant be hungry, Gornbad is a GOLEM!"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad thought after battle warriors get hungry, so Gornbad ate"[PARAGRAPH:1]"By shoving a deer down your gullet? That's not good for you, which explains the mess in here."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad Sorry"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Every time you wander away from the regiment you get damaged, you must stay with the others"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Gornbad saw orcs, has orders to smash orcs."[PARAGRAPH:1]"Those were Elves, stay away from them."[PARAGRAPH:1]"What difference?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Good point. ..Fine, Stay away from anything with sharp objects unless you're with your unit."[PARAGRAPH:1]-Techmage Errod and Gornbad the Iron Golem during a repair session.

TEXT.English: [TAB]"I covered me ears or I'da gone deaf for sure, an me friends did the same. All except Phillio. He stood there, transfixed, an' I'd swear there was a tear in his eye and a smile on his face. 'It is true,' he whispered, 'she lives!' And then if he didn't turn on us whiles we were stunned! Took most of the unit to subdue him, him and a few others. Why, after that, is it any wonder we fled the battlefield?"
TEXT.French: [TAB]"I covered me ears or I'da gone deaf for sure, an me friends did the same. All except Phillio. He stood there, transfixed, an' I'd swear there was a tear in his eye and a smile on his face. 'It is true,' he whispered, 'she lives!' And then if he didn't turn on us whiles we were stunned! Took most of the unit to subdue him, him and a few others. Why, after that, is it any wonder we fled the battlefield?"
TEXT.German: [TAB]"Ich bedeckte meine Augen - andererseits wäre ich mit Sicherheit des Todes gewesen - und meine Freunde taten es mir gleich. Alle außer Phillio. Er stand da, wie versteinert, und ich schwöre eine Träne in seinem Auge und ein Lächeln auf seinem Gesicht gesehen zu haben. 'Es ist war', flüsterte er, 'sie lebt!'. Wir waren für eine Weile wie betäubt, während er uns den Rücken zukehrte. Schließlich wurde er wieder auf uns aufmerksam und es brauchte fast die gesamte Truppe, um in schließlich zu bändigen, ihn und ein paar andere. Wen kann es da noch verwundern, dass wir vom Schlachtfeld flohen?
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]"I covered me ears or I'da gone deaf for sure, an me friends did the same. All except Phillio. He stood there, transfixed, an' I'd swear there was a tear in his eye and a smile on his face. 'It is true,' he whispered, 'she lives!' And then if he didn't turn on us whiles we were stunned! Took most of the unit to subdue him, him and a few others. Why, after that, is it any wonder we fled the battlefield?"

Took most of the unit to subdue him, him and a few others. Why, after that, is it any wonder we fled the battlefield?"

TEXT.English: [TAB]In a graveyard the deceased appear as they wished to be, and not as they actually were. A stone inscribed, "Maria Ghouls, devoted wife of Paulus and loving mother of Henri" ignores the years of fights and beatings at her husband's hand, beatings that eventually led to her death. It doesn't tell of the abuse the father turned on his son after Maria died.[PARAGRAPH:1]They are even worse when the stone mason doesn't know what really happened. Beside her grave another stone reads, "Paulus Ghouls, unable to live without his beloved wife". The stone mason suspected sorrow caused Paulus to walk to the city square and slit his own throat with a quill knife. The mason didn't know that after another night of beating his 10 year old son the boy manifested latent magical powers. The boy used those powers to dominate his father and force him to march out to the city square and kill himself.[PARAGRAPH:1]The tragedy's of a few decades are refined in the graveyard. Though the truth of our lives is too quickly forgotten, our lies are preserved in stone for centuries.

TEXT.English: [TAB]From his position on the turret, Garim watched the Hippus muster on the horizon knowing that they were building for yet another assault. The Khazad had withstood five days of siege from those that would sack the vaults they had worked hard to build.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]He appeared stone-faced, but to those that knew him the evidence of concern was in his eyes. The Hippus numbers had steadily grown day by day whilst the Khazad strength had steadily jaded. They had defended stoutly, and extracted a heavy price of the Hippus-but Rhoanna knew the value of the mines in these hills.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There...movement on the horizon. A change in the atmosphere-dirty black clouds polluting the once bright daylight. The call to arms. Garim felt satisfaction that the call was not met by cries anguish, but by sturdy acceptance that each shall do their utmost. But still this time there was that unsettling feeling that the toil of his kin would be lost to these plunderers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As he adjusted his armor, and tightened the grip on his battle hammer he noted the appearance of the Stonewarden, his heavy soul lifted just at the sight. The Stonewarden addressed his unit, and in an earthy growl repeated three words[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Honesty[NEWLINE]Endeavour[NEWLINE]Tradition[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]and Garim knew, that he and his brethren would stand strong.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The young ones, the aspirants, think that power lies in raining fire down on one's enemies. And while there is an undeniable, if crude, effectiveness to the fireball, true power lies not in destruction, but in creation. Where there is naught but desolation, Spring can bring the elixir of life-water.
TEXT.French: [TAB]The young ones, the aspirants, think that power lies in raining fire down on one's enemies. And while there is an undeniable, if crude, effectiveness to the fireball, true power lies not in destruction, but in creation. Where there is naught but desolation, Spring can bring the elixir of life-water.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Jünglinge und Anwärter glauben, dass ihre Macht hauptsächlich in Dingen wie dem Beschwören eines Feuerregens über den Köpfen ihrer Feinde besteht. Und obwohl eine unbestreitbare, wenn auch plumpe Effektivität in der Nutzung von Feuerbällen liegt, ruht wahre Macht nicht in der Zerstörung, sondern in der Erschaffung. Wo nichts außer Einöde existiert, kann der Frühling das Elixier des Lebens bringen - Wasser.
